abstract: Art gallery owner Hillel Nahmad is to be sentenced for his involvement in international gambling and money-laundering ring; prosecutors are recommending that he be sent to prison for year to 18 months, while Nahmad's lawyers are asking that he be permitted to avoid prison by operating and financing program that will bring young people in Bronx homeless shelter to Metropolitan Museum of Art.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Hillel Nahmad, who pleaded guilty to a charge of operating a gambling business, want him to run and finance a program tied to the Metropolitan Museum of Art as part of his sentencing.

headline.main: Art Dealer Seeks to Avoid Prison
headline.print_headline: Art Dealer Seeks to Avoid Prison
